1.brief: a longing; by implication, a delight (subjectively, satisfaction, objectively, a charm)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
to break through, i.e. spread or separate (oneself)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
support or (by implication) ability, i.e. (direct) help, (in purpose) an undertaking, (intellectual) understanding

2.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

3.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

4.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
to gush forth; figuratively, to utter (good or bad words); specifically, to emit (a foul odor)
properly, something dug, i.e. a (general) source (of water, even when naturally flowing; also of tears, blood (by euphemism, of the female pudenda); figuratively, of happiness, wisdom, progeny)

5.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

6.brief: the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
properly, a dissolution; concretely, a ruin, or (abstractly) consternation
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

8.brief: a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
properly, to burn in, i.e. (figuratively) to rankle

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything

9.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)
properly, deputyship, i.e. ministry; generally, employment (never servile) or work (abstractly or concretely); also property (as the result of labor)
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense)
to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively)

strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)

to be (causatively, make) lofty, especially inaccessible; by implication, safe, strong; used literally and figuratively
a figure (carved on stone, the wall, or any object); figuratively, imagination

a fracture, figuratively, ruin; specifically, a solution (of a dream)
to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

condescension, human and subjective (modesty), or divine and objective (clemency)

a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
properly, non-occurrence; used adverbially, not yet or before
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, to keep in; hence, to measure; figuratively, to maintain (in various senses)

to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative

to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after

to broaden (intransitive or transitive, literal or figurative)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)

17.brief: first, in place, time or rank (as adjective or noun)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to penetrate; hence, to examine intimately

18.brief: to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)
properly, a pebble, i.e. a lot (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a portion or destiny (as if determined by lot)
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or
powerful (specifically, a paw); by implication, numerous
to break through, i.e. spread or separate (oneself)

to break away (from just authority), i.e. trespass, apostatize, quarrel
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)

alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)

to issue, i.e. furnish; causatively, to secure; figuratively, to succeed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

23.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
